steps: Place the lime wedges in a glass.
Add the sugar on top of the lime wedges.
Muddle the lime and sugar together to release the lime juice and dissolve the sugar.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour the cachaça over the ice.
Stir well to mix all the ingredients.
drink_image_description: A vibrant Caipirinha cocktail in an Old Fashioned glass with visible muddled lime wedges and ice cubes. The glass is rimmed with condensation, showcasing the fresh lime wheel garnish on the side. The photo is taken from a slightly elevated angle with soft natural lighting emphasizing the bright green hues of the lime against a bright, blurred background.
drink_history: The Caipirinha is Brazil's national cocktail, originating from the early 20th century. It combines cachaça, a distilled spirit made from fermented sugarcane juice, with fresh lime and sugar. The drink symbolizes Brazilian culture and is often enjoyed during celebrations and gatherings.

flavor_profile.mouthfeel: Light and refreshing with slight graininess from the sugar.
flavor_profile.finish: Clean and crisp finish with lingering lime zest.
flavor_profile.balance: Well balanced between the tartness of lime and sweetness of sugar, complemented by the earthy notes of cachaça.

serving_size_base.batch_preparation_notes: When making a batch, muddle limes and sugar together before adding cachaça and ice.

enhanced_steps.action: Place the lime wedges in the glass.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use fresh limes and cut them into wedges to maximize juice extraction.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: The glass bottom is covered with lime wedges.
common_mistakes: Using pre-squeezed lime juice instead of fresh lime wedges.

enhanced_steps.action: Add the sugar on top of the lime wedges.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use granulated sugar for the best texture and sweetness.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Sugar covers the lime wedges evenly.
common_mistakes: Using powdered sugar which dissolves too quickly.
enhanced_steps.timing_guidance: Add sugar right after placing lime wedges.

enhanced_steps.action: Muddle the lime and sugar together to release the lime juice and dissolve the sugar.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Press down firmly but avoid over-muddling to prevent bitterness from the lime pith.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Lime wedges are crushed but still retain some texture.
common_mistakes: Not muddling enough, leaving sugar undissolved.

enhanced_steps.action: Fill the glass with ice cubes.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use fresh, clear ice cubes for best dilution control.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Glass is filled to the top with ice cubes.
common_mistakes: Using crushed ice which can dilute the drink too quickly.

enhanced_steps.action: Pour the cachaça over the ice.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Pour evenly to ensure proper mixing with lime and sugar.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Clear liquid poured gently over ice.
common_mistakes: Pouring too quickly causing uneven mixing.

enhanced_steps.action: Stir well to mix all the ingredients.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use a bar spoon or stir stick to combine the flavors thoroughly.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Evenly mixed drink with visible lime pieces.
common_mistakes: Not stirring enough leading to uneven flavor distribution.

suggested_variations.name: Frozen Caipirinha
changes: Use crushed ice instead of ice cubes
suggested_variations.description: A slushy, refreshing variation perfect for hot weather.

suggested_variations.name: Caipiroska
suggested_variations.description: A vodka-based twist on the classic Caipirinha.

drink_trivia.fact: Caipirinha is considered the national cocktail of Brazil.
Cachaça is the most popular distilled spirit in Brazil, made from fermented sugarcane juice.
The drink gained international popularity during the 2016 Rio Olympics.
The name 'Caipirinha' roughly translates to 'little rustic' or 'from the countryside' in Portuguese.
